title: Aaron Lohmann
text:
My name is Aaron Lohmann, I am an econ PhD candidate at IfW Kiel and Bielefeld University. Deeply interested in empirical and theoretical economics research on aspects of the digital economy.
Download my CV here: Download CV

title: Bootstraps & Bandings
text:
Are the residential property bands of 3 decades ago becoming less so? Would a sample of those recently-sold reveal band convergence? And what may be inferred about those not sampled?
Over the years, urban properties have been added to and divided up. And two streets of equal attractiveness, and with equivalently-banded properties, may have diverged as neighbourhoods evolved.
Whilst properties can and do move to higher or lower bands following alteration, would a sample of those recently-sold reveal band convergence after so long? And what may be inferred about the wider housing stock?

title: Reading Course in Statistical Sciences
text: A reading course in statistical sciences held in the summer term of 2023 at university Bielefeld. Taking the wonderful book Causal Inference - The Mixtape by Scott Cunningham as a structuring guideline. Students had to present one method in each week and we discussed empirical papers applying these techniques all together.

title: Aaron Lohmann
text:
Hello there!
Welcome to my personal homepage. I am an aspiring empirical economist who is deeply interested in exploring aspects of digital economics. I explore theoretical and empirical contributions in this field mostly using data originating from Github. In case you are curious about my research or care to collaborate, feel free to contact me.

title: Reading Course in Statistical Sciences
text: A reading course in statistical sciences held in the summer term of 2023 at university Bielefeld. Taking the wonderful book Causal Inference - The Mixtape by Scott Cunningham as a structuring guideline. Students had to present one method in each week and we discussed empirical papers applying these techniques all together.

title: QJE - PhD Reading Group
text: This reading group intends to discuss the current research in brought aspects of economics. It is designed from PhD students for PhD students. All PhD students in the field of economics are warmly invited. We discuss every two to three weeks one of the papers in the most recent issue of Quartely Journal of Economics. The scope of the reading group is intentionally brought to allow us doctoral students a brought understanding of economics instead of focusing narrowly on our own research topics.

title: QJE - PhD Reading Group
text:
Schedule







Date
Topic




01.06.2023 - 4 pm (Central European Time)
Web of Power: How Elite Networks Shaped War and Politics in China - Ying Bai, Ruixue Jia, Jiaojiao Yang

title: Yahoo is still useful - sort of
text: Yes Yahoo still exists. Forgotten by most, it can however still serve as a wonderful data source for downloading financial data. Here, I cover a very simple code which allows to download multiple financial time series at once, match observational periods, save the data and produce plots of values and returns of those time series. Nothing fancy and is something I did as a research assistant some time back but still maybe it is useful to someone.
